description.narrative: 4.1 Programme Planning and Monitoring: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 2707 Luanda Republic of Angola

sector.narrative: Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)

title.narrative: Angola United Nations Development Assistance Framework
"UNICEF Programmes in Angola (Planning Monitoring and Evaluation)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.1 Programme Planning and Monitoring: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes.

description.narrative: In collaboration with the Ministry of Economy and Planning (MEP), capacity building strategy was formulated, in particular with regards to the results-based management (RBM) approach (remote modality). Also, technical support and coordination has been provided through the UN system in Angola, including the UN-wide COVID-19 Response and Recovery Plan 2020-21; the SDG platform in Angola; the MAPS (mainstreaming accelerated policy support mission); iSDG as well as technical assistance to the National Statistics Institute (INE) and procurement of equipment (including tablets and accessories) to support the IIMS 2020 (DHS). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/08/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of COVID-related interventions (PCAs / SSFAs / PDs / HPDs/ etc.) including relevant COVID-19 global indicators
Percentage of critical ACO management events (MYRs, EYRs and MTR) with proper planning guidance and tools
% of UNICEF partners with improved knowledge and understanding of PSEA standards and protocols
Integrated two-year Rolling Work Plan (RWP adjusted for COVID-19 when corresponds) signed by targeted national counterpart by June of each year
Annual Management Plan (AMP) completed and shared with all staff and RO within first quarter of each year
